abstract: Top stories from regional papers this week.
snippet: Top stories from regional papers this week.
lead_paragraph: Jammu and Kashmir: India's longest railway tunnel, through the Pir Panchal mountain range, was opened on Friday. The seven-mile long tunnel, which will "connect Kashmir with the outside world," will be operational by 2012, Northern Railway officials said. (Greater Kashmir)Manipur: A 2-month-old blockade on arterial highways connecting Manipur is wreaking havoc in the state, the Manipur People's Party said, causing skyrocketing prices for food, fuel and other basic amenities. (Nagaland Post) However, the chief minister of Manipur, Okram Ibobi, rubbished these reports, saying "you people sit there and report, come to Manipur tomorrow and see it is not true." (Telegraph)
